alert.note: Alert for Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook; Weston (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 02 at 2:03PM MDT until April 05 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Blizzard conditions expected Monday afternoon into Wednesday for the Black Hills and western South Dakota... .A strong spring snowstorm will bring very heavy snow to the area, beginning across northeastern Wyoming and southwestern South Dakota Monday morning, spreading northeastward through the day. Winds will increase Monday with widespread 45-65 mph gusts across the area Tuesday afternoon, strongest winds across the western South Dakota plains. The combination of very heavy snow, strong winds, and blowing and drifting snow will result in very difficult travel conditions late Monday through Wednesday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON MONDAY TO NOON MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Strongest winds expected Tuesday morning into Tuesday evening. * WHERE...Northern Campbell County, Southern Campbell County, Western Crook County and the Weston County Plains. * WHEN...From noon Monday to noon MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook; Weston
